all_news.title: Analysis Firm Warns About XRP and DOGE – “Speculative Positions…”
Chainalysis CEO offers a clue into the recent spate of Paris crypto attacks
all_news.translated_facebook_post: Serangan penyamun kripto di Paris baru-baru ni sebenarnya tunjuk ramai penjenayah tak sedar transaksi kripto boleh dikesan, polis dah banyak tangkap penjenayah, dan mungkin duit tebusan pun boleh dapat balik.
all_news.translated_title: Ketua Pegawai Eksekutif Chainalysis memberi petunjuk mengenai siri serangan kripto di Paris baru-baru ini.
all_news.translated_content:
**Crypto Kidnappings Highlight Misconception About Traceability, Says Chainalysis CEO**

A string of recent crypto-related kidnappings underscores a persistent misconception among some criminal organizations: cryptocurrency is traceable.  This is according to Chainalysis CEO Jonathan Levin, who spoke at the 2025 Consensus crypto conference.

Levin highlighted law enforcement's increasing success in tracing stolen funds and crypto ransom payments, leading to numerous arrests.  He attributed the kidnappings to a belief that crypto is untraceable, a perception apparently held by some organized crime groups, particularly, though not exclusively, in France.

This assertion is supported by two serious crypto-related attacks in Paris this month.  On May 13th, assailants attempted to kidnap the daughter and grandson of Pierre Noizat, co-founder and CEO of Paymium. Earlier, on May 3rd, Paris police rescued the father of a crypto entrepreneur held captive in a 7 million euro ($7.8 million) kidnapping plot.  These incidents prompted France's interior minister to meet with crypto professionals to address rising security concerns.

These attacks echo concerns raised last October by blockchain investigator ZachXBT, who reported a surge in crypto home invasion thefts in Western Europe.

Levin emphasized the need to disseminate the message that crypto payments are traceable and that law enforcement agencies are effectively prosecuting these crimes, targeting both the kidnappers and the organized crime groups behind them.  He cited the March 2025 home invasion of online streamer Amouranth, where suspects were arrested and charged.

Levin believes the recent arrests should deter future crimes, suggesting that crypto kidnapping is "not such a profitable business."  He noted the possibility of recovering ransom payments, although the primary goal remains holding perpetrators accountable.

Despite law enforcement successes, Levin described the situation as "bleak," urging the industry to bolster security measures and advising individuals to be cautious about sharing personal information online.

While a GitHub list compiled by Jameson Lopp shows 22 recorded in-person crypto thefts this year compared to 28 in 2024, a University of Cambridge study suggests underreporting due to victims' fears of further victimization.  The actual number of incidents is likely higher.
all_news.translated_summary: Pengasas bersama Chainalysis, Jonathan Levin, berkata penjenayah yang menyasarkan industri kripto perlu memahami satu perkara sebelum melancarkan sebarang rompakan baharu…

all_news.title: MetaMask Co-Founder Says MASK Token Still in Talks
all_news.translated_facebook_post: Mungkin akan ada token MASK kelak, tapi masih dalam perbincangan; MetaMask akan umumkan sendiri kalau betul-betul ada.

Is Cardano (ADA) a Good Crypto Investment in 2025?
all_news.translated_facebook_post: Harga Cardano (ADA) sekarang agak rendah berbanding harga tertinggi sebelum ini,  namun masih menarik perhatian ramai disebabkan pembangunannya yang teliti dan rancangan masa depan yang jelas.  Pelaburan dalam Cardano tetap berisiko tinggi, tetapi berpotensi memberi pulangan lumayan jangka panjang.
